Commentary / Israel/Palestine

The Gaza Starvation Experiment

Israel’s new U.S.-backed aid scheme in Gaza integrates food into military strategy. Since the war began, Israel has restricted aid, easing up when famine alerts appeared, tightening as attention faded. Now, amid a bloody rollout, the new mechanism risks entrenching starvation rather than ending it.

On the World Stage, Trump Can’t Always Get What He Wants
Commentary / Global

On the World Stage, Trump Can’t Always Get What He Wants

The following is adapted from a report from Crisis Group’s President and CEO Comfort Ero to the organisation’s Trustees in mid-May 2025. She and Executive Vice President Richard Atwood look at the second Trump administration’s foreign policy moves to date and curbs on his stated ambitions.

Statement / Middle East & North Africa

Saving Gaza from Starvation

Israel’s plan to conquer Gaza and impose a new aid scheme threatens to prolong the war and weaponise the starving population’s most vital needs. Gulf Arab states have a chance to press the U.S. to put an end to the Israeli government’s endless escalations.

Statement / Europe & Central Asia

Deal or No Deal, a Basis for Talks about Peace in Ukraine

The Trump administration has opened space for diplomacy to end Russia’s war in Ukraine. Its proposed deal, seemingly agreed to previously with Moscow, and the Kremlin’s offer to speak directly to Kyiv, are an opportunity for continued talks.

Commentary / Israel/Palestine

The Gaza Starvation Experiment

Israel’s new U.S.-backed aid scheme in Gaza integrates food into military strategy. Since the war began, Israel has restricted aid, easing up when famine alerts appeared, tightening as attention faded. Now, amid a bloody rollout, the new mechanism risks entrenching starvation rather than ending it.

Saving Gaza from Starvation

Israel’s plan to conquer Gaza and impose a new aid scheme threatens to prolong the war and weaponise the starving population’s most vital needs. Gulf Arab states have a chance to press the U.S. to put an end to the Israeli government’s endless escalations.

Statement / Europe & Central Asia

Deal or No Deal, a Basis for Talks about Peace in Ukraine

The Trump administration has opened space for diplomacy to end Russia’s war in Ukraine. Its proposed deal, seemingly agreed to previously with Moscow, and the Kremlin’s offer to speak directly to Kyiv, are an opportunity for continued talks.

#  [ The Gaza Starvation Experiment ](https://www.crisisgroup.org/middle-east-north-africa/east-mediterranean-mena/israelpalestine/gaza-starvation-experiment)
Israel’s new U.S.-backed aid scheme in Gaza integrates food into military strategy. Since the war began, Israel has restricted aid, easing up when famine alerts appeared, tightening as attention faded. Now, amid a bloody rollout, the new mechanism risks entrenching starvation rather than ending it.

Commentary / Israel/Palestine

The Gaza Starvation Experiment

Israel’s new U.S.-backed aid scheme in Gaza integrates food into military strategy. Since the war began, Israel has restricted aid, easing up when famine alerts appeared, tightening as attention faded. Now, amid a bloody rollout, the new mechanism risks entrenching starvation rather than ending it.

The following is adapted from a report from Crisis Group’s President and CEO Comfort Ero to the organisation’s Trustees in mid-May 2025. She and Executive Vice President Richard Atwood look at the second Trump administration’s foreign policy moves to date and curbs on his stated ambitions.

Statement / Middle East & North Africa

Saving Gaza from Starvation

Israel’s plan to conquer Gaza and impose a new aid scheme threatens to prolong the war and weaponise the starving population’s most vital needs. Gulf Arab states have a chance to press the U.S. to put an end to the Israeli government’s endless escalations.

Statement / Europe & Central Asia

Deal or No Deal, a Basis for Talks about Peace in Ukraine

The Trump administration has opened space for diplomacy to end Russia’s war in Ukraine. Its proposed deal, seemingly agreed to previously with Moscow, and the Kremlin’s offer to speak directly to Kyiv, are an opportunity for continued talks.

Commentary / Israel/Palestine

The Gaza Starvation Experiment

Israel’s new U.S.-backed aid scheme in Gaza integrates food into military strategy. Since the war began, Israel has restricted aid, easing up when famine alerts appeared, tightening as attention faded. Now, amid a bloody rollout, the new mechanism risks entrenching starvation rather than ending it.

Statement / Middle East & North Africa

Saving Gaza from Starvation

Israel’s plan to conquer Gaza and impose a new aid scheme threatens to prolong the war and weaponise the starving population’s most vital needs. Gulf Arab states have a chance to press the U.S. to put an end to the Israeli government’s endless escalations.

Statement / Europe & Central Asia

Deal or No Deal, a Basis for Talks about Peace in Ukraine

The Trump administration has opened space for diplomacy to end Russia’s war in Ukraine. Its proposed deal, seemingly agreed to previously with Moscow, and the Kremlin’s offer to speak directly to Kyiv, are an opportunity for continued talks.

#  [ The Gaza Starvation Experiment ](https://www.crisisgroup.org/middle-east-north-africa/east-mediterranean-mena/israelpalestine/gaza-starvation-experiment)
Israel’s new U.S.-backed aid scheme in Gaza integrates food into military strategy. Since the war began, Israel has restricted aid, easing up when famine alerts appeared, tightening as attention faded. Now, amid a bloody rollout, the new mechanism risks entrenching starvation rather than ending it.

#  [ The Gaza Starvation Experiment ](https://www.crisisgroup.org/middle-east-north-africa/east-mediterranean-mena/israelpalestine/gaza-starvation-experiment)
Israel’s new U.S.-backed aid scheme in Gaza integrates food into military strategy. Since the war began, Israel has restricted aid, easing up when famine alerts appeared, tightening as attention faded. Now, amid a bloody rollout, the new mechanism risks entrenching starvation rather than ending it.

Since the war began, Israel has restricted aid, easing up when famine alerts appeared, tightening as attention faded. Now, amid a bloody rollout, the new mechanism risks entrenching starvation rather than ending it. Latest Updates Gender & Conflict My Reading List On the World Stage, Trump Can’t Always Get What He Wants Commentary / Global On the World Stage, Trump Can’t Always Get What He Wants The following is adapted from a report from Crisis Group’s President and CEO Comfort Ero to the organisation’s Trustees in mid-May 2025. She and Executive Vice President Richard Atwood look at the second Trump administration’s foreign policy moves to date and curbs on his stated ambitions. As South Sudan Quakes, an Heir Apparent Rises Podcast / Africa As South Sudan Quakes, an Heir Apparent Rises Bomb the Cartels? Expel the Migrants? Reboot Monroe? Crisis Group expert Franklin Nossiter considers the implications of Wagner Group’s departure from Mali, and its replacement by the Africa Corps Analyst's Notebook / Latin America & Caribbean Assassination Attempt on Top Politician Stirs Colombian Anxieties Analyst's Notebook / Latin America & Caribbean Low Turnout Mars Mexico’s Bid to Elect Its Judges Analyst's Notebook / Africa Is the Trump Administration Going to Bring the Central Sahelian States in from the Cold? Middle East Tensions Read more on the issue Statement / Middle East & North Africa Saving Gaza from Starvation Israel’s plan to conquer Gaza and impose a new aid scheme threatens to prolong the war and weaponise the starving population’s most vital needs. Gulf Arab states have a chance to press the U.S. to put an end to the Israeli government’s endless escalations. Podcast / Middle East & North Africa Netanyahu Against the World? Anger Mounts over Gaza’s Starvation Q&A / Middle East & North Africa Is the Gaza War Approaching Its Endgame? Q&A / Middle East & North Africa What Lies in Store for Syria as a New Government Takes Power? War in Ukraine Read more on the war in Ukraine Statement / Europe & Central Asia Deal or No Deal, a Basis for Talks about Peace in Ukraine The Trump administration has opened space for diplomacy to end Russia’s war in Ukraine. Its proposed deal, seemingly agreed to previously with Moscow, and the Kremlin’s offer to speak directly to Kyiv, are an opportunity for continued talks. images.alt: Displaced Palestinians walk along a road to receive humanitarian aid packages from a US-backed foundation in Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip on June 5, 2025.
images.desc: Commentary / Israel/Palestine The Gaza Starvation Experiment Israel’s new U.S.-backed aid scheme in Gaza integrates food into military strategy. Since the war began, Israel has restricted aid, easing up when famine alerts appeared, tightening as attention faded. Now, amid a bloody rollout, the new mechanism risks entrenching starvation rather than ending it.

Analyst's Notebook / Africa Mali and Russia Restructure Their Security Partnership – But to What End? Crisis Group expert Franklin Nossiter considers the implications of Wagner Group’s departure from Mali, and its replacement by the Africa Corps

Statement / Middle East & North Africa Saving Gaza from Starvation Israel’s plan to conquer Gaza and impose a new aid scheme threatens to prolong the war and weaponise the starving population’s most vital needs. Gulf Arab states have a chance to press the U.S. to put an end to the Israeli government’s endless escalations.

Statement / Europe & Central Asia Deal or No Deal, a Basis for Talks about Peace in Ukraine The Trump administration has opened space for diplomacy to end Russia’s war in Ukraine. Its proposed deal, seemingly agreed to previously with Moscow, and the Kremlin’s offer to speak directly to Kyiv, are an opportunity for continued talks.
